articles.title: Today I’m toying with
articles.description: The simple joy of gadgets — that’s what “Today I’m Toying With” is all about. It’s our video series where we try to encapsulate that joy of playing with technology, sharing what it’s like to experience gadgets that not all of us get to touch! Like a 3D printer that prints delicious chocolate, or the […]

articles.title: AlphaEarth Foundations helps map our planet in unprecedented detail
articles.description: New AI model integrates petabytes of Earth observation data to generate a unified data representation that revolutionizes global mapping and monitoring
articles.content: New AI model integrates petabytes of Earth observation data to generate a unified data representation that revolutionizes global mapping and monitoring

articles.title: AI Security Institute launches international coalition to safeguard AI development
articles.description: AI Security Institute joins forces with Canadian counterpart, Amazon, Anthropic and civil society in new research project focused on AI behaviour and control.
articles.content: AI Security Institute joins forces with Canadian counterpart, Amazon, Anthropic and civil society in new research project focused on AI behaviour and control.

articles.title: Accenture Invests in YearOne to Boost AI-Driven Software Development
articles.description: YearOne will join Accenture Ventures’ Project Spotlight, a program that connects startups with Accenture’s business experts and global clients. The post Accenture Invests in YearOne to Boost AI-Driven Software Development appeared first on Analytics India Magazine.

articles.title: The Machine Ethics podcast: AI Ethics, Risks and Safety Conference 2025
articles.description: Hosted by Ben Byford, The Machine Ethics Podcast brings together interviews with academics, authors, business leaders, designers and engineers on the subject of autonomous algorithms, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and technology’s impact on society. articles.title: AIhub monthly digest: July 2025 – RoboCup round-up, ICML in Vancouver, and leveraging feedback in human-robot interactions

articles.title: miniHDL: A Python Hardware Description Language DSL
articles.description: A small hardware description language implemented as a DSL on Python, with a small 170 LoC 32-bit RISC CPU.
articles.content: A small hardware description language implemented as a DSL on Python, with a small 170 LoC 32-bit RISC CPU.

articles.title: Import AI 422: LLM bias; China cares about the same safety risks as us; AI persuasion

articles.title: Toward using explainable data-driven surrogate models for treating performance-based seismic design as an inverse engineering problem
articles.description: arXiv:2508.00286v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: This study presents a methodology to treat performance-based seismic design as an inverse engineering problem, where design parameters are directly derived to achieve specific performance objectives. By implementing explainable machine learning models, this methodology directly maps design variables and performance metrics, tackling computational inefficiencies of performance-based design. The resultant machine learning model is integrated as an...
articles.author: Mohsen Zaker Esteghamati
articles.content: arXiv:2508.00286v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: This study presents a methodology to treat performance-based seismic design as an inverse engineering problem, where design parameters are directly derived to achieve specific performance objectives. By implementing explainable machine learning models, this methodology directly maps design variables and performance metrics, tackling computational inefficiencies of performance-based design. The resultant machine learning model is integrated as an...

articles.title: Building AIOps with Amazon Q Developer CLI and MCP Server
articles.description: In this post, we discuss how to implement a low-code no-code AIOps solution that helps organizations monitor, identify, and troubleshoot operational events while maintaining their security posture. We show how these technologies work together to automate repetitive tasks, streamline incident response, and enhance operational efficiency across your organization.
articles.author: Biswanath Mukherjee
articles.content: In this post, we discuss how to implement a low-code no-code AIOps solution that helps organizations monitor, identify, and troubleshoot operational events while maintaining their security posture. We show how these technologies work together to automate repetitive tasks, streamline incident response, and enhance operational efficiency across your organization.

articles.title: Google rolls out Gemini Deep Think AI, a reasoning model that tests multiple ideas in parallel
articles.description: Google released its first publicly available "multi-agent" AI system, which uses more computational resources, but produces better answers.
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff
articles.content: Google released its first publicly available "multi-agent" AI system, which uses more computational resources, but produces better answers.

articles.title: At $250 million, top AI salaries dwarf those of the Manhattan Project and the Space Race
articles.description: A 24 year-old AI researcher will earn 327x what Oppenheimer made while developing the atomic bomb.
articles.author: Benj Edwards
articles.content: A 24 year-old AI researcher will earn 327x what Oppenheimer made while developing the atomic bomb.

articles.title: SabiYarn: Advancing Low-Resource Languages With Multitask NLP Pre-Training [Paper Reflections]
articles.description: In recent years, Large Language Models (LLMs) have mostly improved by scaling. This has primarily involved increasing the size of the LLMs and the data they are trained on, resulting in a highly resource-intensive process that can cost up to millions of dollars. While LLMs have become ubiquitous, the resource-intensive pre-training process poses a threat…
articles.author: Oduguwa Damilola
articles.content: In recent years, Large Language Models (LLMs) have mostly improved by scaling. articles.title: RecoMind: A Reinforcement Learning Framework for Optimizing In-Session User Satisfaction in Recommendation Systems
articles.description: arXiv:2508.00201v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Existing web-scale recommendation systems commonly use supervised learning methods that prioritize immediate user feedback. Although reinforcement learning (RL) offers a solution to optimize longer-term goals, such as in-session engagement, applying it at web scale is challenging due to the extremely large action space and engineering complexity. In this paper, we introduce RecoMind, a simulator-based RL framework designed for the effective...
articles.author: Mehdi Ben Ayed, Fei Feng, Jay Adams, Vishwakarma Singh, Kritarth Anand, Jiajing Xu
articles.content: arXiv:2508.00201v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Existing web-scale recommendation systems commonly use supervised learning methods that prioritize immediate user feedback. Although reinforcement learning (RL) offers a solution to optimize longer-term goals, such as in-session engagement, applying it at web scale is challenging due to the extremely large action space and engineering complexity. In this paper, we introduce RecoMind, a simulator-based RL framework designed for the effective...

articles.title: Dimension-reduced Reconstruction Map Learning for Parameter Estimation in Likelihood-Free Inference Problems
articles.description: arXiv:2407.13971v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Many application areas rely on models that can be readily simulated but lack a closed-form likelihood, or an accurate approximation under arbitrary parameter values. Existing parameter estimation approaches in this setting are generally approximate. Recent work on using neural network models to reconstruct the mapping from the data space to the parameters from a set of synthetic parameter-data pairs suffers from the curse of...

articles.title: StackLiverNet: A Novel Stacked Ensemble Model for Accurate and Interpretable Liver Disease Detection
articles.description: arXiv:2508.00117v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Liver diseases are a serious health concern in the world, which requires precise and timely diagnosis to enhance the survival chances of patients. The current literature implemented numerous machine learning and deep learning models to classify liver diseases, but most of them had some issues like high misclassification error, poor interpretability, prohibitive computational expense, and lack of good preprocessing strategies. In order to address...
articles.author: Md. Ehsanul Haque, S. M. Jahidul Islam, Shakil Mia, Rumana Sharmin,  Ashikuzzaman, Md Samir Morshed, Md. Tahmidul Huque
articles.content: arXiv:2508.00117v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Liver diseases are a serious health concern in the world, which requires precise and timely diagnosis to enhance the survival chances of patients. The current literature implemented numerous machine learning and deep learning models to classify liver diseases, but most of them had some issues like high misclassification error, poor interpretability, prohibitive computational expense, and lack of good preprocessing strategies. In order to address...

articles.title: INSPIRE-GNN: Intelligent Sensor Placement to Improve Sparse Bicycling Network Prediction via Reinforcement Learning Boosted Graph Neural Networks
articles.description: arXiv:2508.00141v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Accurate link-level bicycling volume estimation is essential for sustainable urban transportation planning. However, many cities face significant challenges of high data sparsity due to limited bicycling count sensor coverage. To address this issue, we propose INSPIRE-GNN, a novel Reinforcement Learning (RL)-boosted hybrid Graph Neural Network (GNN) framework designed to optimize sensor placement and improve link-level bicycling volume estimation...
articles.author: Mohit Gupta, Debjit Bhowmick, Rhys Newbury, Meead Saberi, Shirui Pan, Ben Beck
articles.content: arXiv:2508.00141v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Accurate link-level bicycling volume estimation is essential for sustainable urban transportation planning. However, many cities face significant challenges of high data sparsity due to limited bicycling count sensor coverage. To address this issue, we propose INSPIRE-GNN, a novel Reinforcement Learning (RL)-boosted hybrid Graph Neural Network (GNN) framework designed to optimize sensor placement and improve link-level bicycling volume estimation...

articles.title: Pure interaction effects unseen by Random Forests
articles.description: arXiv:2406.15500v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Random Forests are widely claimed to capture interactions well. However, some simple examples suggest that they perform poorly in the presence of certain pure interactions that the conventional CART criterion struggles to capture during tree construction. Motivated from this, it is argued that simple alternative partitioning schemes used in the tree growing procedure can enhance identification of these interactions. In a simulation study these...
articles.author: Ricardo Blum, Munir Hiabu, Enno Mammen, Joseph Theo Meyer
articles.content: arXiv:2406.15500v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Random Forests are widely claimed to capture interactions well. However, some simple examples suggest that they perform poorly in the presence of certain pure interactions that the conventional CART criterion struggles to capture during tree construction. Motivated from this, it is argued that simple alternative partitioning schemes used in the tree growing procedure can enhance identification of these interactions. In a simulation study these...

articles.title: Constructive Disintegration and Conditional Modes
articles.description: arXiv:2508.00617v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Conditioning, the central operation in Bayesian statistics, is formalised by the notion of disintegration of measures. However, due to the implicit nature of their definition, constructing disintegrations is often difficult. A folklore result in machine learning conflates the construction of a disintegration with the restriction of probability density functions onto the subset of events that are consistent with a given observation. We provide a...
articles.author: Natha\"el Da Costa, Marvin Pf\"ortner, Jon Cockayne
articles.content: arXiv:2508.00617v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Conditioning, the central operation in Bayesian statistics, is formalised by the notion of disintegration of measures. However, due to the implicit nature of their definition, constructing disintegrations is often difficult. A folklore result in machine learning conflates the construction of a disintegration with the restriction of probability density functions onto the subset of events that are consistent with a given observation. We provide a...

articles.title: TriP-LLM: A Tri-Branch Patch-wise Large Language Model Framework for Time-Series Anomaly Detection
articles.description: arXiv:2508.00047v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Time-series anomaly detection plays a central role across a wide range of application domains. With the increasing proliferation of the Internet of Things (IoT) and smart manufacturing, time-series data has dramatically increased in both scale and dimensionality. This growth has exposed the limitations of traditional statistical methods in handling the high heterogeneity and complexity of such data. Inspired by the recent success of large language...
articles.author: Yuan-Cheng Yu, Yen-Chieh Ouyang, Chun-An Lin
articles.content: arXiv:2508.00047v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Time-series anomaly detection plays a central role across a wide range of application domains. With the increasing proliferation of the Internet of Things (IoT) and smart manufacturing, time-series data has dramatically increased in both scale and dimensionality. This growth has exposed the limitations of traditional statistical methods in handling the high heterogeneity and complexity of such data. Inspired by the recent success of large language...

articles.title: FACTORY: A Challenging Human-Verified Prompt Set for Long-Form Factuality
articles.description: arXiv:2508.00109v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Long-form factuality evaluation assesses the ability of models to generate accurate, comprehensive responses to short prompts. Existing benchmarks often lack human verification, leading to potential quality issues. To address this limitation, we introduce FACTORY, a large-scale, human-verified prompt set. Developed using a model-in-the-loop approach and refined by humans, FACTORY includes challenging prompts that are fact-seeking, answerable, and...
articles.author: Mingda Chen, Yang Li, Xilun Chen, Adina Williams, Gargi Ghosh, Scott Yih
articles.content: arXiv:2508.00109v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Long-form factuality evaluation assesses the ability of models to generate accurate, comprehensive responses to short prompts. Existing benchmarks often lack human verification, leading to potential quality issues. To address this limitation, we introduce FACTORY, a large-scale, human-verified prompt set. Developed using a model-in-the-loop approach and refined by humans, FACTORY includes challenging prompts that are fact-seeking, answerable, and...
